posts.post_content:
Is this the one that closed on eBay last night? So you do not have in hand?


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

Thanks for the interest and the bump Ed.  While it’s a new acquisition I can assure anyone interested that it’s a completed transaction that’s been paid for and on its way to me.  I have tracking info on the item as well as dozens of hobby references for anyone who may be concerned.
Don't really care that you're selling before you have it, but I doubt it grades that high with the crease across the neck.

2 comments in this section definitely deserve infractions. Let's make them verbal this time. 
The one about when it sold and the one about how it would grade should not be here.....PM me to discuss further OR post this issue in the thread on the front page and see what others think about the comments? Not that it really matters because, imo, they are out of line. But we could see what others think too. Thanks

If you are referring to my post there was nothing about price or anything else aside if card was on eBay night before. It was a simple yes or no question. If there was a picture posted then there would be no need for this question. 

Maybe revising rules somewhat such as listing a price and showing a picture would alleviate it. 

But it is also quite obvious of retaliation with actual price And auction on Mayo cut Delahanty listed.  I can honestly care less about it but that is a clear warning. 




Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

Your questioning of him having the card is absolutely out of line if you ask me. No more revising of rules. If you don't know if your post in someone elses post might cross the line just PM me...better yet, you should have PMd the OP with your question. And on the retaliation issue, it is being addressed now. 

[quote name="ezez420" post=1879259]If you are referring to my post there was nothing about price or anything else aside if card was on eBay night before. It was a simple yes or no question. If there was a picture posted then there would be no need for this question. 

Maybe revising rules somewhat such as listing a price and showing a picture would alleviate it. 

But it is also quite obvious of retaliation with actual price And auction on Mayo cut Delahanty listed.  I can honestly care less about it but that is a clear warning.
